definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: On weekends, I'll catch the morning movie for my visual enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 在週末時，俺都去看早場電影，享受視覺饗宴喜悅。

sentences.english: Let's go to see matinee movies.
I always go to matinees since they're a lot cheaper.
sentences.chinese: 我總是去看早場演出，因爲價錢便宜很多。

sentences.english: Let's go to see matinee movies and save a few bucks.
sentences.chinese: 我們去看早場的電影省幾塊錢吧。

sentences.english: On learning that there were no buses, they decided to go to the early performances.
sentences.chinese: 得知沒有公共汽車了，他們決定去看早場演出。

sentences.english: It is difficult when we come back after the international break and play an early kick off.
sentences.chinese: 在國際比賽之後，打一場早場的比賽很困難。

definition: lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
to assign sb to a seat/to be allocated a place
time of day exactly on the hour (i.e. 12:00, 1:00 etc)/to make an inventory/(math.) point that has integer coordinates
number plate/car license plate/CL:條|条[tiao2],塊|块[kuai4],片[pian4]
